title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 22 ยง 112.1 - Appellate papers reproduced by methods other than printing
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 22 ยง 112.1 - Appellate papers reproduced by methods other than printing

State Regulations

Appellate papers reproduced by methods
other than printing, pursuant to rule 5529 of the Civil Practice Law and Rules, must be reproduced on a good grade of at least 20-pound, white, opaque, unglazed paper. Any method of reproduction which produces a permanent, legible, black-on-white copy on the above paper shall be accepted. Wherever such a
paper, presented to a clerk for filing, is not legible or otherwise suitable, the clerk may refuse to accept the same. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 22
ยง
112.1

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
